abstract.shortdesc: A navigation title is an alternate title that is designed for situations when the topic title is unsuitable for use in a table of contents or navigation pane. This might be the case when the topic title is very long.

section.title: Usage information
section.p: The navtitle element is available in both topics and maps.

Because the navtitle element is available within topicmeta, and topicmeta is used in many different contexts, it is possible that navtitle can be specified in contexts where a navigation title does not make sense (for example, on the topicgroup element). In those situations, the navtitle element has no defined purpose.

section.title: Processing expectations
section.p: When the navtitle element is used in a topic, processors should use the contents of the element to generate the navigation title.
When the navtitle element is used in a map, processors should retrieve the navigation title in the following order:

ol.li: From the content of a navtitle element in the map, if the containing topicref element sets the value of the locktitle attribute to "yes"
From the contents of a navtitle element in the referenced topic
From the title of the referenced topic

section.title: Attributes
section.p: The following attributes are available on this element: .

fig.title: navtitle sample in a topic
fig.codeblock: <task id="progexample"> <title>Publishing a DITA information set in PDF</title> <titlealts><navtitle>Publishing in PDF</navtitle></titlealts> <taskbody><context>Some text</context></taskbody> </task>

fig.title: navtitle samples in a map
fig.p: In this sample, the first title is not locked, and will generally be replaced with a title retrieved from a.dita. The second title is locked, and will be displayed when this map is used as a basis for navigation.
fig.codeblock: <map xml:lang="en"> <title>This is a sample map</title> <topicref href="a.dita"> <topicmeta> <navtitle>Title of A</navtitle> </topicmeta> </topicref> <topicref href="b.dita" locktitle="yes"> <topicmeta> <navtitle>Short Title for B</navtitle> </topicmeta> </topicref> </map>
